names.pinyin: yi qi jian pi fu zheng tang
names.english: boost qi, fortify the spleen and support the righteous decoction
names.commonEnglish: Boost Qi, Fortify the Spleen and Support the Righteous Decoction

actions: Tonifies Qi and Blood, strengthens the Spleen, raises the Yang Qi of the Spleen and Stomach, promotes urination and reduces edema .
With Bai Zhu, for Spleen Qi Deficiency with weakness, lassitude and loose stools.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, clears Heat, soothes irritability, cools the Blood, reduces abscesses, nourishes the Blood and calms the Spirit.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness and strengthens the Spleen.
With Bai Zhu, strengthens the Spleen and resolves Dampness.
With Zhi Ban Xia and Chen Pi, for nausea, vomiting, chest fullness and distention and anorexia due to congested fluids.
Tonifies the Kidneys, strengthens Yang.
With Xian Mao, for chills, impotence with Cold sperm, Cold extremities and infertility.
Tonifies the Middle Jiao and augments Qi.
With Fu Ling, for Spleen and Stomach Deficiency.
With Bai Zhu, for Spleen Qi Deficiency with anorexia, loose stools and vomiting.
With Huang Qi, for Lung and Spleen Qi Deficiency.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, dries Dampness and promotes water metabolism.
Nourishes the Blood and astringes Yin.
With Dang Gui, nourishes Yin and Blood.
Clears Heat, relieves toxicity and promotes urination.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood and disperses Cold.
With Huang Qi, for Qi and Blood Deficiency.
With Bai Shao, regulates and harmonizes Qi and Blood.
With Chen Pi and Zhi Ban Xia, for Lung and Kidney Yin Deficiency with overflowing water turning to Phlegm.
Dries Dampness, transforms Phlegm, descends Rebellious Qi and stops vomiting.
With Chen Pi, for epigastric and abdominal distention or pain due to disharmony of the Stomach Qi.
With Fu Ling, for Phlegm, thin mucus and turbid Dampness.
Regulates Qi, adjusts the Middle, dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
With Bai Zhu, for anorexia and other symptoms of Damp Obstruction due to Spleen Deficiency.
Tonifies the Kidneys, strengthens Yang, expels Cold and eliminates Dampness.
Improves the Spleen's transportive function, astringes Jing and urine and stops enuresis.
With Bai Zhu, increases appetite.
Warms and Reinforces the Spleen and Kidneys
Invigorates the Blood
Transforms Stasis

symptoms: Low back, knees are sore and weak
Legs and feet are aching and painful
Superficial edema which is more marked below the waist
manifestations.tongue: Pale, tender, moist and swollen maybe with teethmarks
manifestations.tongueCoat: Thin and white or White and greasy
manifestations.pulse: Deep and weak or Deep, thready, weak and maybe slow
